definition: to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: It was the site of a British victory over the Saxons in571. Population, 74, 500.
sentences.chinese: 它是571年大不列颠人打败撒克逊人的遗址。

sentences.english: Chapter 1. Anglo-Saxon or whatever happen to the Jutes.
sentences.chinese: 第一章，盎格鲁撒克逊人或发生在朱特人的任何事。

sentences.english: It was the site of a British victory over the Saxons in 57. Population, 74,500.
sentences.chinese: 它是57年大不列颠人打败撒克逊人的遗址。

sentences.english: The ancestors of many English people were the ancient Angles and Saxons.
sentences.chinese: 许多英国人的祖先是古盎格鲁和撒克逊人。

sentences.english: The defeat of 1066 signal(1)ed the end of Saxon rule in England.
sentences.chinese: 之战败标志着撒克逊人在英国统治之结束。

sentences.english: They were the Saxons and the Jutes.
sentences.chinese: 他们是撒克逊人和朱特人。

sentences.english: The ancestors of many English people were the ancient Angles and Saxo .
sentences.chinese: 许多英国人的祖先是古盎格鲁和撒克逊人。

sentences.english: Buns marked with a cross were eaten by the Saxons to honour a goddess.
sentences.chinese: 撒克逊人把小面包做成十字形的也是为了向神致敬。

pinyin: Ang4 ge2 lu3 Sa1 ke4 xun4
